name: Golden Sands Resort by Shangri-La

reviews.text: Just arrived back from this beautiful hotel. One of the nicest I have stayed at. The view from the balcony is just fantastic. Overlooking the pools to the ocean which has so much activity. Banana boating, horse riding, jet skiing, paragliding and much more. The staff were fantastic, the buffet breakfast one of the best I have encountered. Overall a great stay.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: I can see why this hotel gets such mixed reviews and I think all it depends on what your expectations are before you arrive.
reviews.title: Ok but needs a refurb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived at GS after fived days at the Mandarin Oriental in KL, I was fully aware that the standard of accommodation was going to drop and I was therefore prepared for it. In the end it was better than I had expected.
reviews.title: Do NOT waste your money!!! Absolutely Disgusting!!!

likes.liked: — The smell of the rooms, the sticky & stained furniture & carpet, the whole thing was unliveable

reviews.text: In my opinion the hotel is probably a 3 star and not the 4 star it is advertised at. This hotel was opened in 1980 and does need a refurb as the furniture and look of the place is a bit dated. On arrival we upgraded to a suite at a fairly reasonable cost and that gave us a lot more space. The public areas ( pools, gardens, lobby) are kept in good condition, The standard rooms are definitely due a refurb and there is a smell in most of the corridors but fortunately the smell hadn't spread to the room we were given. If you are planning on staying here go for the seaview room and ask for levels 5 and above.
reviews.title: great family holiday

likes.disliked: — the selection of food in the coffee house and pool cafe

reviews.text: On the whole the staff were friendly but the level of service cannot be compared to the Mandarin in KL. THe breakfast choice was fine and had all the usual stuff you would expect.. Evening entertainment is limited in and around the hotel. I wasn't overly impressed with the night market and the general feel of the place outside the hotel. In the evenings we tended to go into Georgetown.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Golden Sands Resort for 4 nights, having stayed at 5 other hotels in Malaysia I have to say, this was not the best hotel....it is advertised as sandy beaches..which it is, and views of the sea (the Straits of Malacca), what you dont find out until you get there is that there are hoards of jelly fish, we were told by someone that we could chance it, but if we go to the beach we should take some vinigar to relieve the sting, and then is should only be painful for a few hours! The rooms smelt of stale dampness. The pool area was lovely, and so were the views from the back of the hotel. It was expensive and so was the food. If you want a beach holiday, the East coast (south china sea) is far better. Penang itself is lovely, lots to see, A good hotel in Georgetown, Penang is the `g` hotel, recently refurbished into a Japenese, minimalistic style. A good hotel in the South, is the Selesa hotel in Port Dickson, very friendly staff....and NO jelly fish.
reviews.title: jelly fish in sea

likes.liked: — pool area and view from back of the hotel
likes.disliked: — cant go in the sea & expensive by Malaysian standards.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Golden Sands late Feb - early March, we both thought it was a fantastic hotel and would definitely visit it again. The staff go out of their way to be helpful, reception bar staff, chambermaids all are pleasant & polite. Some guests we spoke to had been returning every year for 19 years, there was certainly a reunion atmosphere as they met fellow guests from previous years.
reviews.title: upgrade to seaview

reviews.text: I would recommend upgrading to a seaview room, we did this on arrival, cost 50% less than booking it through Kuoni in UK but you take a chance on availability, hill facing rooms have no balcony & overlook the car park & main road.
reviews.title: Home from home!

reviews.text: The beach is stunning but most guests stayed round the pool, plenty of sunbeds and a shade is a must, if you want something to eat or drink whilst sunbathing, just wave a red flag and they take your order and deliver to where you're sitting. They do have happy hours, the Pool Bar was 5pm - 7pm, Ziggys 10.30 to midnight.
reviews.title: Get the Seafacing View room

reviews.text: We ate out every night, Mario's & Jewel of the North were our favourites, food is incredibly cheap but drinks, particularly wine, can double the cost. A night market runs the length of the main road with all the usual fake goods to be bartered for.
reviews.title: Relaxing but...

likes.disliked: — not enough non-smoking floors in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon getting to the Golden Sands after travelling and hanging round for about 18 hours we found that the deluxe sea view room we were promised was not available so they put us in one they claim is jungle facing but is in fact road facing with the jungle in the far far distance!
reviews.title: Not a great experience

reviews.text: Went down to the pool the next day to find the main activity pool was close for refurbishment for a month but as it was a sunday and was still plenty of space to relax its right on the beach but sea is filthy and touts galore to hassle you!
reviews.title: Lovely Resort

reviews.text: After a lot of hassle we got our sea facing room, but they next day were awoken by the sound of pnematic drills, the pool that was closed the previous day was having construction work done on it, you don't really want to be woken by that at 9am on your hols. After speaking to the hotel, our rubbish hayes and jarvis rep who made us wait in our room for 5 hours whilst he sorted it out as claimed he would call us back staright away we got moved to the far superior Park Royal down the road.
reviews.title: A little disappointing

likes.disliked: — noise from mosque in the car park

reviews.title: Nice garden and pools
reviews.text: The book had also said we could use the hotel next door to the golden sands but it was still being built so there was no way of that happening!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful stay at Shangri-La Golden Sands Resort, first visit and very impressed. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful, with activities such as water basketball and volleyball everyday. The ideal location makes it easy to stroll into the town at night with a night market and many restaurants such as "Jewel of the North" well worth as visit, and trust me you will not be dissappointed!
reviews.title: Perfect for a winter break

reviews.text: I can thoroughly recommend a stay at this resort when visiting penang. The ocean facing rooms are lovely. Our children were in the rear facing rooms and they did suffer from occasional smoke smells coming through the A/C and also being woken at 5am by the mosque over the road. So I would definitely recommend paying the extra for the ocean facing rooms
reviews.title: Excellent base for exploring penang

likes.liked: — the very friendly and helpful staff
likes.disliked: — smoke smells in the rear facing rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds, pool and facilities of the hotel are beautiful and the staff are very friendly and very professional. All meals were terrific and very good value and the 3 piece band that played every evening were exceptionally good.
reviews.title: Just Great!

reviews.text: A word of warning though. I would not go to this resort (or penang in general for that matter) if you are expecting a beach holiday. The beach is not particularly pleasant and the water is neither clear or inviting. This didn't worry us as we have wonderful beaches at home in Australia and we came to see Penang rather than lie on a beach.
reviews.title: Bed like concrete, beach like bedlam

likes.liked: — Pool and reflexology on the beach
likes.disliked: — Mis-advertised - no Starfy Kid's club available

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The markets outside of the hotel of a evening are great fun and the restaurant strip outside the hotel is also great value especially the Indian restaurants.
reviews.title: Horrible - smelly - desperate need of a refurb

likes.disliked: — The smell and the old fashioned decor

reviews.text: Penang itself is a fantastic place to visit and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I even learnt to enjoy driving in the crazy traffic.
reviews.title: Great place for families with small children!

aka: Golden Sands Resort By Shangri-La Hotel
description: Golden Sands Resort by Shangri-La in Malaysia, Penang is the epitome of premier resort getaway for families, groups and individual travellers. Situated in the midst of a laid-back seaside village and the popular Batu Feringgi beach, its locale provides ample opportunity for exploration and leisure. Embraced by sun, surf and fun, the resort's diversity and accessibility is the perfect antidote for jet lag and boredom. Among its 387 rooms include the biggest family suites, with some equipped with Murphy beds (a retractable bed that fits neatly into walls). Dining options include Sigi's Bar & Grill on the beach, a Garden Cafe with 360 degree view of the gardens and pools, a Lobby Lounge overlooking the landscaped garden, state-of-art meeting rooms, banquet hall and Cool Lounge, an innovative transit lounge for early check-in and late check-out stand ready to serve guests. George Town, a UNESCO world heritage site is a short drive away. So are the island's nature trails and myriad cultural centres. Recreational facilities include a water sports center, three tennis courts, Health Club , a Par 3 Executive Golf Courts, two swimming pools with an outdoor Jacuzzi and Adventure Zone, an in house Family Entertainment Centre. An evolving recreational calendar includes activities organized for in-house guests of all ages
